thread.title: Country Thunder in Arizona: See what it looked like in 1998 through 2016
thread.title_full: Country Thunder in Arizona: See what it looked like in 1998 through 2016

author: Chelsey F. Heath , The Republic | azcentral.com
title: Country Thunder in Arizona: See what it looked like in 1998 through 2016
text:
Kix Brooks (left) and Ronnie Dunn, of Brooks & Dunn, perform at Country Thunder in Florence on April 8, 2006. (Photo: Deirdre Hamill/The Republic) 
101 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Country Thunder Arizona, known for country-music headliners and a non-stop party atmosphere, has over a decade of history in the state.
Above, see azcental.com photos of the event, from 1998 all the way up to the 2016 affair.
COUNTRY THUNDER 2017: Send us YOUR photos | Road to Country Thunder fest on April 1 | Blake Shelton, Dierks Bentley, Thomas Rhett and Chris Young top the bill 
Can't get enough boots, cowboy hats and jams? Read our full 2016 event coverage below.
MORE: Country Thunder's lost and found | The 6 types of people you see | Social-media recap | Best, craziest things we spotted so far | Arizona singer: 'It was never something I'd imagine would happen' | Day 4: Eric Church is icon in the making | Day 3 review: Chris Janson steals Thunder with tribute | Day 2 review: Florida Georgia Line | Day 1 review: Kip Moore (eventually) | Photos: Country Thunder through the years | Performers honor Merle Haggard | Country Thunder playlist 
Facebook Twitter Google+ LinkedIn PHOTOS: Best of Country Thunder Arizona 2016   Fullscreen Post to Facebook Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed.
